medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe facial erythema with itching and skin edema after starting oral iron treatment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed symptoms 24 hours after beginning treatment with ferrous sulfate, following 15 years of uneventful oral iron therapy with ferric propionate. Symptoms included severe facial erythema, itching, and skin edema, which disappeared within 5 days after stopping the treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Persistent iron deficiency anemia; previous contact dermatitis related to occupation as a hairdresser.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had to change her occupation from hairdresser due to contact dermatitis.
